sentences.english: This web siter is incredible source for around.
sentences.chinese: 这个网站是不可思议的源泉左右。

sentences.english: Another fantastic picture is the piece of small household dust below.
sentences.chinese: 另一幅不可思议的图片是下面这张家庭微尘的照片。

sentences.english: "It's really amazing how smooth these trajectories are, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “这些轨迹线都呈现出不可思议的平滑状态，”他说。

sentences.english: Captain Mayes was amazed by the amount of time and effort put into building the set.
sentences.chinese: 梅耶斯上尉对布景所花费的时间和精力感到不可思议。

sentences.english: As its name indicates, Professional wear refers to the garments for professionals.
sentences.chinese: 职业装，顾名思议，就是能够标明职业特征的服装。

sentences.english: The merits, virtues and adornments such as these are inconceivable.
sentences.chinese: 如是功德庄严，不可思议。

sentences.english: Newton's summer of 1665 was really part of an annus mirabilis, a marvelous year, as it is often called.
If he was a conspirator, it seemed inconceivable that he would have done so.
sentences.chinese: 如果司机是同谋，那他这么做似乎不可思议。
一位前男友有着不可思议的手指。

sentences.english: Lunge past your foes with preternatural speed to attack them from behind.
sentences.chinese: 你冲到敌人身后，以不可思议的速度从后面攻击他们。

sentences.english: The light will illuminate clearly immeasurable, innumerable, inconceivable Buddhas' World Realms in the ten directions.
sentences.chinese: 彻照十方无量无数不可思议诸佛世界。

sentences.english: It’s an incredible thing to know you have.
sentences.chinese: 知道你拥有机会也是一件不可思议的事。

sentences.english: "These Amerasians are pretty amazing, " Nancy said.
sentences.chinese: 这些美亚混血儿太不可思议了。

sentences.english: The third baseman made some remarkable stops.
sentences.chinese: 第三垒守垒员做了一些不可思议的拦截。

sentences.english: It's also incredibly water-intensive. The average U.
sentences.chinese: 同样也是不可思议的雨水加强器。

sentences.english: Now think of it, that 6:00 on the Morning Reading is simply unthinkable.
sentences.chinese: 现在想起来，觉得六点上早读简直是不可思议的事情。

definition: chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
to free oneself/to extricate oneself from a difficult situation
mystery within a mystery/the mysteries of the Dao according to Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
to fathom/to make sense of/to grasp
appearance (esp. superficial)/looks/to judge a person by appearances
indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
the thirty-two physical characteristics of Buddha
